name: PEST
description: Model-Independent Parameter Estimation and Uncertainty Analysis.

metadata.title: A model-independent iterative ensemble smoother for efficient history-matching and uncertainty quantification in very high dimensions
metadata.abstract: Â© 2018 Elsevier Ltd An open-source, scalable and model-independent (non-intrusive) implementation of an iterative ensemble smoother has been developed to alleviate the computational burden associated with history-matching and uncertainty quantification of real-world-scale environmental models that have very high dimensional parameter spaces. The tool, named pestpp-ies, implements the ensemble-smoother form of the popular Gauss-Levenberg-Marquardt algorithm, uses the pest model-interface protocols and includes a built-in parallel run manager, multiple lambda testing and model run failure tolerance. As a demonstration of its capabilities, pestpp-ies is applied to a synthetic groundwater model with thousands of parameters and to a real-world groundwater flow and transport model with tens of thousands of parameters. pestpp-ies is shown to efficiently and effectively condition parameters in both cases and can provide means to estimate posterior forecast uncertainty when the forecasts depend on large numbers of parameters.
